title: Arrival at the Hospital
text: You and your partner have just arrived at the maternity ward. The nurse asks if you remembered to bring the hospital paperwork.

answers.text: Calmly check your bag and hand over the paperwork.
Panic and insist the nurse should have it already.

title: Supporting Breathing
text: Your partner is starting to feel stronger contractions. The nurse asks you to help guide breathing.

answers.text: Gently follow the nurse’s demonstration and encourage slow breaths.
Tell your partner to 'just relax' without offering real support.

title: Communicating with the Nurse
text: Your partner asks you to notify the nurse that contractions are closer together.

answers.text: Go politely and clearly explain the contraction timing to the nurse.
Yell down the hall for the nurse to hurry.

title: Comfort Options
text: Your partner seems tense and uncomfortable. The nurse offers several comfort items.

answers.text: Ask your partner whether they'd like a warm blanket or back rub.
Decide for them and push a position they don't want.

title: Contraction Timing
text: The nurse asks you to keep track of contraction intervals.

answers.text: Use your phone timer to log times carefully.
Guess the timing and say 'I think they're close enough.'

title: Pain Relief Discussion
text: Your partner is considering an epidural. They ask what you think.

answers.text: Stay supportive and reassure that any choice they make is valid.
Make the decision for them because 'you know what's best.'

title: Encouraging Through Labor
text: Your partner is exhausted and needs encouragement while pushing.

answers.text: Offer steady words of strength and hold their hand.
Tell them they're taking too long and they need to push harder.

title: Nurse Request
text: The nurse asks you to grab some ice chips from the nearby station.

answers.text: Quickly retrieve the ice chips and bring them back.
Refuse because you're 'too stressed right now.'

title: Final Delivery Support
text: It’s the final moments. Your partner needs focused encouragement and calm presence.

answers.text: Stay close, maintain eye contact, and reinforce their strength.
Start filming without asking and distract everyone.

title: Game Over
text: Sorry you are kindly asked to leave the birth room
